result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Macquan John'ta Chapman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt appeared by video for Macquan John'ta Chapman.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Burlo. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 16. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt appeared by video for Macquan John'ta Chapman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is unavailable due to a personal matter. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman in court.  Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court for Macquan John'ta Chapman.  Attorney Patrick Franken in court on behalf of Annie Louk for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for State V Lee Hearing. Court advises parties that although today was calendared for a State V Lee Hearing, SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing to prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman appeared by video, in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Macquan John'ta Chapman
Current: 3266 N 90th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 9341 West Silver Spring Drive # 8, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant previously posted $1,750 cash bail. Court orders $1,500 remains and the rest be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Macquan John'ta Chapman in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Thomas L. Potter, along with student intern Madaline Witte under the student pracrice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@1pm
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-15-2022 @1p
